column3: do we have someone on OpenBSD or likewise to test this?
Please squash your commits according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits
@MarcoFalke Fixed! :-)
> do we have someone on OpenBSD or likewise to test this?\n\nWe don't have any tests for most of these scripts, period :(

With the exception of the sh -> bash change when needed and clear fixes for edge cases (eg the || exit 1s), both of which I think we should do, I'm not sure what this accomplishes aside from code churn...are the other things going to break on some shell, or are they deprecated in a way that they will be removed within the next ~decade? We've had plenty of issues with otherwise innocuous shell scri

maybe

```diff

+INITIAL_COMMIT=${CURRENT_COMMIT}
 
 while true; do
 	if [ "$CURRENT_COMMIT" = $VERIFIED_ROOT ]; then
-		echo "There is a valid path from "$CURRENT_COMMIT" to $VERIFIED_ROOT where all commits are signed!"
+		echo "There is a valid path from "$INITIAL_COMMIT" to $VERIFIED_ROOT where all commits are signed!"
In quotes, please.
